main event: A light, resembling the moon, was observed moving from north to south in Toms River, New Jersey.
interesting points: The object appeared to have the same brightness and shape as the moon., Observers thought it may not have been a star due to its consistency with moonlight., The object was estimated to be moving at approximately 60 miles per hour., There was no physical evidence or extensive corroborative witness confirmation., The investigation concluded the event could be related to a satellite.
witness description: The observers described the object as having a similar color and brightness to the moon.
